org.apache.cassandra.thrift

Interface ITransportFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SSLTransportFactory, TFramedTransportFactory

    public interface ITransportFactory
    Transport factory for establishing thrift connections from clients to a remote server.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY 

    • Method Summary

    • Field Detail

      • PROPERTY_KEY

        static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_KEY
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • openTransport

        org.apache.thrift.transport.TTransport openTransport(java.lang.String host,
                                                   int port)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Opens a client transport to a thrift server. Example: 
         TTransport transport = clientTransportFactory.openTransport(address, port);
 Cassandra.Iface client = new Cassandra.Client(new BinaryProtocol(transport));
        Parameters:
        host - fully qualified hostname of the server
        port - RPC port of the server
        Returns:
        open and ready to use transport
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - implementation defined; usually throws TTransportException or IOException if the connection cannot be established

      • setOptions

        void setOptions(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> options)
        Sets an implementation defined set of options. Keys in this map must conform to the set set returned by ITransportFactory#supportedOptions.
        Parameters:
        options - option map

      • supportedOptions

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> supportedOptions()
        Returns:
        set of options supported by this transport factory implementation
